intro: Lessertia astragalina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow or orange pea-like flowers, which are clustered in racemes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Lessertia astragalina is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
